output: Brusque secured a 3-1 win over Mirassol at Estádio Doutor Hercílio Luz on April 24, 2024. The home team took an early lead with Rodolfo Potiguar scoring in the 8th minute, and maintained their advantage going into halftime with a 1-0 scoreline. In the second half, Mirassol's Dellatorre converted a penalty in the 50th minute to reduce the deficit, but Brusque responded with two more goals, including an own goal by Luiz Otávio in the 67th minute and a late strike from Anderson Rosa in the 90+7' minute. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards handed out to players from both teams, with a total of five bookings for Brusque and two for Mirassol. In the end, Brusque's victory was confirmed after the fulltime whistle blew, with referee Jefferson Ferreira de Moraes overseeing the proceedings.

Deportivo Garcilaso and Cuiaba played to a 1-1 draw at Estadio Inca Garcilaso de la Vega on April 24, 2024. The first half ended scoreless, with both teams creating few scoring opportunities. In the second half, Cuiaba's I. Pitta scored in the 73rd minute, but Deportivo Garcilaso equalized just three minutes later through a goal by C. Beltrán. Both teams had players sent off, with Aldair Salazar of Deportivo Garcilaso receiving a red card in the 53rd minute and Clayson of Cuiaba being ejected in the 89th minute. The match ultimately ended in a draw after five substitutions were made by Deportivo Garcilaso and six by Cuiaba.

Sportivo Trinidense secured a 2-0 win over Nacional Potosí in their CONMEBOL Sudamericana Group Stage match on April 24, 2024, at Estadio Defensores del Chaco in Asunción. The home team took an early lead with F. Romero scoring in the 15th minute and maintained a 1-0 advantage at halftime. In the second half, J. Salcedo scored the second goal for Sportivo Trinidense in the 62nd minute, assisted by O. Giménez. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the match, with Sportivo Trinidense making five changes and Nacional Potosí making four. The game saw a total of three yellow cards issued to players from both teams, with Wildo Alonso and Tomas Rayer from Sportivo Trinidense, and Pedro Azogue from Nacional Potosí receiving cautions.

Atlético-MG secured a 3-2 win over Peñarol at Arena MRV on April 24, 2024. The home team took an early lead with goals from Gustavo Scarpa and Paulinho in the 15th and 26th minutes, respectively, making it 2-0 by halftime. In the second half, Atlético-MG extended their lead to 3-0 with another goal from Gustavo Scarpa, before Peñarol scored two goals through M. Olivera and M. Silvera in the 60th and 68th minutes. Several yellow cards were handed out throughout the match, including to Renzo Saravia, Otavio, Jemerson, A. Franco, M. Olivera, and D. Aguirre. The game ultimately ended with Atlético-MG claiming a hard-fought victory.

Liverpool Montevideo secured a 1-0 win over San Lorenzo at Estadio Centenario on April 24, 2024. The first half ended goalless with both teams creating few scoring opportunities. In the second half, San Lorenzo received several yellow cards, including ones for G. Lujan, J. Romana, and E. Remedi, while Liverpool Montevideo's L. Rodriguez also received a yellow card. The winning goal was scored by F. Nicola in the 90+5 minute, securing the victory for Liverpool Montevideo. Several substitutions were made throughout the game by both teams, with San Lorenzo making five changes and Liverpool Montevideo making three.

Argentinos JRS secured a 1-0 win over Corinthians in their CONMEBOL Sudamericana Group Stage match at Estadio Diego Armando Maradona. The home team took the lead early on with a goal from G. Verón in the 2nd minute, assisted by E. Viveros. Both teams received yellow cards throughout the game, with Corinthians' Raul Gustavo also being given a red card in the 59th minute for violent conduct. Several substitutions were made by both teams during the match, but neither was able to change the score. The game ultimately ended 1-0 in favor of Argentinos JRS, with the referee P. Maza overseeing the match.

Colo Colo and Alianza Lima played to a scoreless draw at Estadio Monumental David Arellano on April 24, 2024. The match saw several yellow cards issued, with players from both teams receiving cautions for various infractions, including tripping, roughing, and holding. Substitutions were made by both teams throughout the game, with Colo Colo making four changes and Alianza Lima making four as well. Despite the numerous bookings and substitutions, neither team was able to find the back of the net, resulting in a 0-0 final score. The referee for the match was D. Herrera, who oversaw the contest that lasted the full 90 minutes.

Tigres FC secured a 1-0 win over Cucuta in their Copa Colombia match at Estadio Metropolitano de Techo. The first half ended goalless with both teams failing to find the back of the net. However, the game took a significant turn when Cucuta received a red card in the 28th minute. Despite being down a player, Cucuta managed to hold off Tigres FC until the 90+3 minute when O. Aragon scored the winning goal for Tigres FC. The match ultimately ended with Tigres FC claiming victory and Cucuta suffering a loss.

Real Espana secured a 2-1 win over Génesis at Estadio Olímpico Metropolitano on April 24, 2024. The home team took an early lead with two goals scored by J. Varela and A. Tatum in the 35th and 45+1 minutes respectively. Both teams received several yellow cards throughout the match, with Real Espana's L. Lopez also receiving a red card in the 84th minute. Génesis managed to pull one goal back in the 90+6 minute through R. Moreira. The match ultimately ended with Real Espana claiming the victory, with referee M. Matamoros overseeing the proceedings.

Cavalry FC secured a 1-0 win over Vancouver FC in their Canadian Championship preliminary round match at ATCO Field on April 24, 2024. The first half ended goalless with both teams creating few scoring opportunities. Cavalry FC's S. Shome received a yellow card in the 17th minute and another in the 61st minute, resulting in a red card. The winning goal was scored by T. Warschewski in the 66th minute. Both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the game, with Cavalry FC making five changes and Vancouver FC making four.

Alianza Petrolera hosted Universidad Catolica at Estadio Armando Maestre Pavajeau on April 24, 2024, with the away team ultimately winning 3-1. The home side took an early lead when E. Batalla scored in the 8th minute, but this advantage was short-lived as Universidad Catolica equalized and then took control of the game. Universidad Catolica's goals came from P. Franco, who scored an own goal for Alianza Petrolera, J. Cifuente, and I. Díaz, with the latter two scoring in the 68th and 78th minutes respectively. Both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the match, with a total of nine changes made by the two sides. The game ended with Universidad Catolica claiming victory, having overcome Alianza Petrolera's initial lead to win 3-1.

Junior and LDU de Quito played to a 1-1 draw at Estadio Metropolitano Roberto Meléndez on April 24, 2024. The scoring began early with Junior's C. Bacca converting a penalty in the 12th minute, but LDU de Quito equalized before halftime when A. Arce scored from the spot in the 45th minute. Both teams had multiple yellow cards throughout the match, including bookings for H. H. Mena Posada and M. Estrada in the 21st minute. Several substitutions were made by both teams in the second half, with Junior making four changes and LDU de Quito making three. The match ultimately ended in a tie after 90 minutes, with no goals scored in extra time as none was played.

Colombia U20 W secured a 1-0 victory over Peru U20 W in their CONMEBOL U20 Femenino match at Estadio Modelo Alberto Spencer Herrera on April 24, 2024. The first half ended goalless with both teams failing to find the back of the net. In the second half, Colombia U20 W made several substitutions, including N. Hernández, D. Garavito, K. Osorio, K. Viancha, and M. López, before eventually breaking the deadlock in the 82nd minute when M. Álvarez scored a penalty goal. Peru U20 W also made substitutions, bringing on players such as V. Gherson, E. Díaz, and S. Porras, but were unable to equalize. The match ultimately ended with Colombia U20 W emerging as the winner, thanks to their lone goal, and the referee A. Quisbert blew the final whistle after 90 minutes of play.

Club America and Pachuca played to a 1-1 draw at Estadio Azteca on April 24, 2024. The scoring began early with Á. Zendejas of Club America finding the net in the 12th minute, but Pachuca equalized before halftime when A. Micolta scored in the 40th minute. Both teams had multiple yellow cards throughout the match, including Alejandro Zendejas and Miguel Rodriguez, who were both booked for fouls. The second half saw several substitutions from both sides as they sought to gain an advantage, but neither team was able to break the deadlock. In the end, the match finished with a 1-1 scoreline after 90 minutes of play.

Bay Olympic secured a 1-0 win over Auckland City at Croatian Cultural Club 1 on April 24, 2024. The only goal of the game was scored by R. Muñoz for Bay Olympic in the sixth minute. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the match, with Auckland City replacing players in the 61st and 74th minutes, while Bay Olympic made changes in the 67th, 81st, and 87th minutes. The referee for the game was A. Wilson, who oversaw a match that ended without any extra time being played. In the end, Bay Olympic's early goal proved to be enough to earn them the victory.

Persebaya Surabaya hosted Bali United at Stadion Gelora Bung Tomo on April 24, 2024, with the away team emerging victorious with a score of 2-0. The first goal was scored by I. Jaya in the 35th minute, assisted by Éber Bessa, giving Bali United a 1-0 lead at halftime. In the second half, P. Mbarga added another goal for Bali United in the 73rd minute, assisted by Éber Bessa, securing their team's win. Throughout the match, several substitutions were made by both teams, with a total of nine changes. The game ended with no goals scored by Persebaya Surabaya, and Bali United was declared the winner.

Ska-khabarovsk won against Rodina Moskva with a score of 2-1 at Stadion imeni V.I. Lenina in Khabarovsk on April 24, 2024. The first half ended goalless for both teams. In the second half, O. Kozhemyakin scored two goals for Ska-khabarovsk, while A. Kalmykov scored one goal for Rodina Moskva. Several substitutions were made by both teams throughout the game, including four substitutions by Rodina Moskva and four by Ska-khabarovsk. The match also saw a few yellow cards given to players from both teams, with Tomas Rukas, Soltmurad Bakaev, Andrey Savinov receiving them.

Central Coast Mariners won 3-0 against Abdish-Ata in their AFC Cup Inter-zonal Finals match at Industree Group Stadium on April 24, 2024. The first half ended goalless with both teams receiving yellow cards for fouls and other infractions. In the second half, Central Coast Mariners' M. Di Pizio scored a goal in the 77th minute, followed by another goal from Mikael Doka in the 86th minute, and finally, M. Di Pizio scored again in stoppage time to seal the victory. Throughout the match, both teams made several substitutions, with Abdish-Ata making five changes and Central Coast Mariners making three. The referee for the match was Kim Hee-Gon.

Sanfrecce Hiroshima won against Nara Club with a score of 6-0 in their J-League Cup match on April 24, 2024, at Konoike Athletic Stadium. The away team took an early lead when Y. Kashiwa scored in the 43rd minute, and they maintained their advantage throughout the game. Sanfrecce Hiroshima added to their score with goals from Y. Ohashi, M. Mitsuta, S. Higashi, P. Sotiriou, and Marcos Júnior. Nara Club's T. Sekiguchi received a red card in the 73rd minute, while Y. Sawada and Y. Tsunami were given yellow cards for the home team. The match ended with Sanfrecce Hiroshima securing a decisive victory, with the final score being 6-0 in their favor.

Thespakusatsu Gunma hosted Kashiwa Reysol at Shoda Shoyu Stadium on April 24, 2024, with the away team ultimately emerging as winners by a score of 3-1. The visitors took control early, scoring three goals before halftime courtesy of Y. Muto, Y. Tatsuta, and S. Toshima. Thespakusatsu Gunma made several substitutions throughout the match in an attempt to shift momentum, including bringing on R. Tagashira, T. Einaga, and R. Sugimoto around the 58-minute mark. The home team finally found the back of the net in stoppage time when R. Sato scored a consolation goal. Despite this late effort, Kashiwa Reysol's strong first half proved decisive as they secured the victory under the guidance of referee A. Ikeuchi.

Yokohama FC and Fagiano Okayama played to a 3-3 draw after extra time at City Light Stadium on April 24, 2024. The match saw several goals scored, with Y. Tanaka scoring for Fagiano Okayama in the 15th minute and H. Ogura responding for Yokohama FC in the 42nd minute. Both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the game, with a total of 11 changes made between them. In extra time, Caprini scored for Yokohama FC in the 107th minute, but Fagiano Okayama had already taken the lead through Y. Tanaka's earlier goal. The referee, H. Shimizu, oversaw the match, which ultimately ended with the score tied after 120 minutes of play.

FC Ryukyu secured a 2-1 win over Gamba Osaka in their J-League Cup match at Tapic Kenso Hiyagon Stadium on April 24, 2024. The home team took an early lead with Y. Tomidokoro scoring in the 43rd minute, and they maintained this advantage going into halftime with a score of 1-0. In the second half, T. Suzuki equalized for Gamba Osaka in the 49th minute, but FC Ryukyu regained their lead when H. Shirai scored in the 76th minute. Several substitutions were made by both teams throughout the match, with FC Ryukyu making five changes and Gamba Osaka making five as well. The game ultimately ended with FC Ryukyu emerging victorious, with the final score being 2-1.

Blaublitz Akita secured a win against Shonan Bellmare with a final score of 2-1. The match remained goalless at halftime, but Shonan Bellmare's S. Fukuda broke the deadlock in the 54th minute. Blaublitz Akita equalized and then took the lead with goals from S. Aoki in the 74th minute and R. Komatsu in the 97th minute. Throughout the game, there were several substitutions made by both teams, with a total of 11 changes. The match ultimately ended after extra time, with Blaublitz Akita emerging as the winner.

Parceiro Nagano won against Kyoto Sanga with a score of 3-2. The match started off strong for Kyoto Sanga, who scored two goals by R. Iida and S. Hiraga within the first 28 minutes. However, Parceiro Nagano's N. Sanda managed to get one goal back before halftime. In extra time, T. Kuroishi and H. Sugii both scored for Parceiro Nagano, securing their team's victory. The game ultimately ended with a final score of 3-2 in favor of Parceiro Nagano after 120 minutes of play.

Yokohama F. Marinos and Ulsan Hyundai FC played a match in the AFC Champions League semi-finals at Nissan Stadium on April 24, 2024. Yokohama F. Marinos scored three goals in the first half through A. Uenaka (13', 30') and Anderson Lopes (21'), while Ulsan Hyundai FC responded with two goals from Matheus Sales (35') and D. Bojanić (42'). The score remained 3-2 at full-time, prompting a penalty shootout to determine the winner. In the shootout, both teams converted several penalties before Yokohama F. Marinos ultimately emerged victorious, winning 5-4. The match referee was A. Faghani.

Kataller Toyama and Shimizu S-pulse played to a scoreless draw through regular time, with neither team able to find the back of the net. The match ultimately came down to penalties, where Kataller Toyama emerged victorious, winning 1-0. Throughout the game, there were several substitutions made by both teams, with Kataller Toyama making six changes and Shimizu S-pulse making five. Additionally, a total of three yellow cards were handed out during the match, two to Kataller Toyama players Y. Kawai and S. Yasumitsu, and one to Shimizu S-pulse player S. Kotake. The match was played at the Toyama Athletic Recreation Park Stadium in front of the home crowd, with F. Nakamura serving as the referee.

Roasso Kumamoto hosted Sagan Tosu at Egao Kenko Stadium on April 24, 2024, with the away team emerging victorious by a score of 1-0. The winning goal was scored by A. Yokoyama in the 26th minute. Osaki of Roasso Kumamoto in the 67th minute. The match ultimately ended with a 1-0 win for Sagan Tosu after 90 minutes of play.

Urawa defeated Gainare Tottori 5-2 in their J-League Cup match at Axis Bird Stadium on April 24, 2024. The visitors took an early lead with goals from H. Takeda and Thiago Santana in the 12th and 17th minutes, respectively. Gainare Tottori's K. Tanaka scored a goal in the 35th minute to make it 2-1 at halftime. In the second half, Urawa extended their lead with goals from A. Ito and S. Nakajima, while Gainare Tottori's S. Matsuki added another goal for the home team. The match ended with a final score of 5-2 in favor of Urawa, with S. Nakajima scoring his second goal in stoppage time.

Chiangrai United hosted Port FC at Singha Chiangrai Stadium for their League Cup Quarter-finals match on April 24, 2024. The home team took an early lead with a goal from Miguel Bianconi in the 13th minute, but Port FC equalized just five minutes later through B. Phala's strike. By halftime, the score was tied at 1-1, and it remained that way until N. Shimura scored for Port FC in the 69th minute to give them a 2-1 lead. The visitors held on to their advantage for the remainder of the game, securing a spot in the next round with a final score of 2-1. Several yellow cards were handed out throughout the match, including to players from both teams, but no one was sent off.

Leeds United U18 secured a 5-0 win over Derby County U18 at Thorp Arch Grange on April 24, 2024. The home team took an early lead with O. Pickles scoring in the 40th minute, and they continued to dominate the game with H. Vincent adding another goal in the 48th minute. Leeds United U18 further extended their lead with goals from H. Gray in the 56th and 62nd minutes, and J. McDonald scored the final goal in the 78th minute. Throughout the match, several players received yellow cards, including D. Agustien, D. Brockie, J. Perry, D. Toulson, H. Gray, C. Bird, and J. Richards, while C. Bird was also given a red card in the 86th minute. Krasnodar 2 hosted Murom at Stadion Akademii FK Krasnodar on April 24, 2024, with the match ending in a 1-2 win for the visiting team. The home side took an early lead when G. Zhilkin scored a goal in the 45th minute of the game, just before halftime. However, Murom equalized and then took the lead with goals from V. Kozlov in the 88th minute and A. Murza in the 90+4 minute. Throughout the match, both teams made several substitutions, with a total of nine changes for Krasnodar 2 and four for Murom. The game also saw two cards issued: a red card to D. A. Golikov of Krasnodar 2 in the 14th minute and a yellow card to A. Murza of Murom in the 90+5 minute.

Bangkok Glass secured a 3-0 win over Ratchaburi in their League Cup quarter-final match at Dragon Solar Park on April 24, 2024. The away team took an early lead with Danilo Alves scoring in the 8th minute, and they maintained this advantage going into halftime with a score of 1-0. Bangkok Glass extended their lead in the second half, with C. Songkrasin scoring two goals in the 85th and 89th minutes. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the match, including Ratchaburi's I. Amada replacing S. Nonthasira in the 57th minute and Bangkok Glass making five changes. The match ultimately ended with a 3-0 victory for Bangkok Glass, who will move on to the next round of the competition.

Persik Kediri and PSS Sleman played to a 4-4 draw at Stadion Brawijaya on April 24, 2024. The match also featured multiple substitutions for both teams, including five for Persik Kediri, as well as several yellow cards issued to players from both sides. Ultimately, the teams finished level at 4-4 after 90 minutes of play.

Buriram United and Lamphun Warrior faced off at Chang Arena, with Buriram United ultimately emerging as the winner. Novosibirsk and Rodina Moskva II played to a 1-1 draw at RFTs Zarya manezh in Novosibirsk on April 24, 2024. The home team took an early lead with A. Kobyalko scoring in the 8th minute. Orenburg hosted Dinamo Moscow at Stadion Gazovik, with the away team ultimately emerging as 2-1 winners. The first half ended goalless, but Dinamo Moscow's K. Tyukavin broke the deadlock in the 55th minute. Orenburg's B. Mansilla equalized in the 77th minute, however, Dinamo Moscow had already taken the lead again through M. Ngamaleu's goal in the 72nd minute. Throughout the match, both teams received yellow cards, with Enppi's Rafik Kabou being booked in the 4th minute and El Geish's Abdel Rahman Shika, Himid Mao Mkami, Farid Shawky, and Ahmed Meteb also receiving cautions. The game ended with a total of nine substitutions made by both teams and a final score of 1-0 in favor of El Geish.

Volga Ulyanovsk hosted Khimik Dzerzhinsk at Stadion Trud on April 24, 2024, with the away team emerging as the winner. The first half ended goalless, but Khimik Dzerzhinsk managed to score in the 58th minute through a normal goal by M. Zhumabekov. Several substitutions were made throughout the game, including five by Khimik Dzerzhinsk and five by Volga Ulyanovsk. Yellow cards were given to players from both teams, with D. Rakhmanov and A. Dashayev from Volga Ulyanovsk, and A. Chubukin and J. Dibirgadzhiev also receiving cautions. The match ultimately ended 1-0 in favor of Khimik Dzerzhinsk, with the referee A. Smolin overseeing the proceedings.

PAOK and Lamia played to a 1-1 draw at Dimotiko Athlitiko Kentro Lamias on April 24, 2024. The home team took an early lead with Vykintas Slivka scoring in the 45' +4 minute, assisted by F. Malçi. However, PAOK equalized late in the game when S. Schwab scored a normal goal at 90' +10 minutes, assisted by K. Despodov. The match saw several yellow and red cards issued to players from both teams, including Vykintas Slivka who received both a yellow and a red card, although the latter was after he had already been substituted out, and Pedro Amaral who also received a red card in stoppage time. Overall, the game ended with the two teams sharing the points.

Deportes Santa Cruz and Deportes Limache played to a 1-1 draw at Estadio Municipal Joaquín Muñoz García on May 27, 2024. The visitors took the lead in the 39th minute with a goal from F. Juárez. In the second half, P. Muñoz equalized for Deportes Santa Cruz in the 77th minute. The match saw several substitutions, with both teams making multiple changes throughout the game. The contest ended with a red card being issued to M. Santos of Deportes Santa Cruz in stoppage time, but it did not affect the final outcome.

Minnesota United II secured a 2-0 win over Colorado Rapids II at Dick's Sporting Goods Park on May 27, 2024. The away team took the lead in the 30th minute with a penalty goal scored by P. Weah. Both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the game, with Colorado Rapids II making five changes and Minnesota United II making five as well. In addition to the goal, there were several yellow cards handed out during the match, including to D. Yapi and D. Amadou of Colorado Rapids II, and D. Mawing of Minnesota United II. The second goal for Minnesota United II was scored by M. Khan in the 90th minute, sealing the victory for the visiting team.

Guatemala and Nicaragua played to a 1-1 draw at PayPal Park in San Jose, California on May 27, 2024. Guatemala took an early lead with a goal from R. Rubín in the 11th minute, which held until halftime. In the second half, Nicaragua equalized with a penalty goal from H. Medina in the 61st minute. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, with Guatemala making six changes and Nicaragua making seven. The match ultimately ended in a tie after 90 minutes of play, with referee J. Freemon overseeing the contest.

Portuguesa FC secured a 2-1 win over Carabobo FC at Estadio Rafael Agustín Tovar on May 27, 2024. The home team took an early lead with goals from C. Ramírez in the 12th minute and D. Carrero in the 25th minute. Carabobo FC reduced the deficit before halftime, thanks to a goal from H. Lezcano assisted by F. Apaolaza in the 42nd minute. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, with a total of eight changes made by Carabobo FC and three by Portuguesa FC. The match ultimately ended with Portuguesa FC claiming the victory, as the final score remained 2-1 after 90 minutes.

Club America won 1-0 against Cruz Azul at Estadio Azteca on May 27, 2024. The first half ended goalless with both teams creating few scoring opportunities. In the second half, Israel Reyes of Club America was given a yellow card for a foul in the 59th minute. Later, a penalty was confirmed for Club America in the 74th minute after a VAR review, and Henry Martín scored from the spot in the 78th minute to give his team the lead. The match saw several substitutions towards the end, with both teams making multiple changes before the final whistle blew.

Bucheon FC 1995 secured a 3-0 win over Asan Mugunghwa at Bucheon Stadium on May 27, 2024. The home team took an early lead with Park Hyun-Bin scoring in the 32nd minute, and they maintained their advantage going into halftime with a 1-0 scoreline. In the second half, Jucie Lupeta scored two goals for Bucheon FC 1995, in the 59th and 82nd minutes respectively, to seal the victory. Throughout the match, both teams made several substitutions, with Asan Mugunghwa making five changes and Bucheon FC 1995 making five as well. The game saw a total of four yellow cards issued, with two going to each team, but no players were sent off.

Ansan Greeners secured a 1-0 win over Busan I Park at Ansan Wa Stadium on May 27, 2024. The first half ended goalless with both teams failing to find the back of the net. In the 72nd minute, Choi Han-Sol scored the only goal of the game for Ansan Greeners, assisted by Jang Yu-Seop. Throughout the match, several substitutions were made by both teams, including five changes by Ansan Greeners and four by Busan I Park. The game also saw two yellow cards given to Ansan Greeners' players, Kim Jae-Sung in the 64th minute and Choi Han-Sol in the 90+4 minute.

Van BB and Hekimoğlu Trabzon played to a 1-1 draw at Atatürk Şehir Stadyumu on May 27, 2024. The first half ended scoreless, with neither team able to find the back of the net. In the second half, F. Sakı scored for Van BB in the 91st minute, but Hekimoğlu Trabzon equalized just six minutes later through a goal by H. Yeşil. There were several substitutions made throughout the game, with both teams making multiple changes to their lineups. The match ultimately ended in a tie, with the final score of 1-1.

Kastamonuspor 1966 hosted 76 Iğdır Belediyespor at Kastamonu Gazi Stadyumu on May 27, 2024, with the away team ultimately winning 3-1. The visitors took an early lead, scoring two goals before halftime courtesy of B. Kara and H. Sönmez. In the second half, E. Soy added a third goal for 76 Iğdır Belediyespor in the 78th minute. Kastamonuspor 1966 managed to pull one back through a penalty scored by M. Çaylı in stoppage time. The match saw several substitutions from both teams, with a total of nine changes made throughout the game.

Pyramids FC secured a 1-0 win over El Gouna FC at the 30 June Air Defence Stadium on May 27, 2024. The home team took an early lead with a goal from Ibrahim Adel in the 27th minute, assisted by F. Mayele. Throughout the game, both teams made several substitutions, with El Gouna FC making five changes and Pyramids FC making four. Marwan Hamdy of Pyramids FC received two yellow cards and subsequently a red card in the 85th minute for fouls. The match ultimately ended with Pyramids FC claiming the victory, as referee Mohamed Salama blew the final whistle after 90 minutes.

The match between Lokomotiv and Surkhon ended with a 1-1 draw at Stadion Lokomotiv in Tashkent. The visitors took an early lead when A. Ismailov scored an own goal for Surkhon in the 12th minute, which remained the only score of the first half. In the second half, Lokomotiv's A. Abdurashidov equalized with a normal goal in the 75th minute. Throughout the game, several substitutions were made by both teams, including multiple changes for Surkhon between the 64th and 81st minutes. The match ultimately finished with no further scoring, resulting in a tie after 90 minutes of play.

Viking II secured a 5-1 win over Lysekloster at SR-Bank Arena on May 27, 2024. The home team took an early lead with goals from H. Tangen and J. Galta in the 12th and 28th minutes, respectively, making it 2-0 at halftime. In the second half, Viking II extended their lead with additional goals from P. Christiansen, E. Austbø (twice), while Lysekloster managed to score a single goal through D. Campher in the 73rd minute. Several substitutions were made by both teams throughout the game, and yellow cards were given to T. Haland of Viking II and D. Gamachis and J. Eftevaag of Lysekloster. The match ultimately ended with Viking II claiming a decisive victory.

Lahti hosted SJK at Lahden Stadion, with the away team ultimately emerging as 4-0 winners. The scoring opened early, with F. Ndiaye netting for SJK in the 9th minute, followed by goals from K. Paananen, Babacar Fati, and S. Yussif before halftime. No further goals were scored after the break, despite both teams making several substitutions throughout the second half. Yellow cards were issued to Pyry Hannola of SJK, Fallou Ndiaye of SJK, and Pablo Andrade of Lahti during the match. The game ended with a fulltime score of 0-4 in favor of SJK.

VPS hosted Inter Turku at Lemonsoft Stadion and secured a 3-1 win. The home team took an early lead with goals from Evgeny Bashkirov and M. Haukioja before halftime, making it 2-0. In the second half, VPS further extended their lead to 3-0 with a goal from G. Vlijter in stoppage time, but Inter Turku managed to score a consolation goal through J. Kekarainen just minutes earlier. Several yellow cards were handed out throughout the match, including to Evgeny Bashkirov, Mikael Almén, Iiro Järvinen, and Jean Fiacre Kouamé Botué. The game ultimately ended with VPS claiming all three points.

Sweden U17 and Italy U17 faced off at Stadio Tasos Markou, with Italy ultimately emerging as the winner with a 2-1 scoreline. The first half ended goalless, but Sweden's F. Bozicevic broke the deadlock in the 57th minute. However, Italy responded with two goals from C. Cama and F. Camarda in the 75th and 80th minutes respectively, securing their victory. Throughout the match, several substitutions were made by both teams, including four by Sweden U17 and four by Italy U17. The game also saw three yellow cards being issued to N. O. Jonsson of Sweden U17, and F. Verde and C. Cama of Italy U17.

Poland U17 secured a 4-0 victory over Slovakia U17 in their UEFA U17 Championship Group Stage match on May 27, 2024, at Stadio Dasaki Achnas. The home team took an early lead with goals from M. Izunwanne and O. Pietuszewski in the 11th and 30th minutes, respectively. Poland U17 added to their tally before halftime as M. Izunwanne scored his second goal of the match in the 44th minute. In the second half, S. Gieroba scored the final goal for Poland U17 in the 67th minute. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, with a total of ten changes made between them.

Kooteepee won 2-1 against KäPa at Arto Tolsa Areena on May 27, 2024. The match started with a goal from Kooteepee's A. Tarvonen in the 11th minute, but KäPa equalized with a goal from E. Kallio in the 27th minute. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, and there were multiple yellow cards given to players on both sides. In the 80th minute, Kooteepee's A. Tanninen scored the winning goal, securing their team's victory. The match ended with a red card being given to KäPa in the 89th minute, but by then the outcome of the game had already been decided.

PK-35 hosted SalPa at Algeco Areena TN in Helsinki, with the match ending 1-1 after 90 minutes. The home team took an early lead when E. Markkanen scored a penalty goal in the 34th minute. However, SalPa equalized late in the game through Olli Jakonen's normal goal in the 90+3 minute. Throughout the match, several players received yellow cards, including M. Tainio and B. Haruna from SalPa, as well as F. Manneh from PK-35, while B. Haruna was also given a red card in the 33rd minute. The game saw multiple substitutions from both teams, with a total of nine changes made by the two sides.

Kolkheti Poti and Dinamo Tbilisi played to a 2-2 draw at Kobuleti Football Center on May 27, 2024. The scoring began early with Ó. Santis of Dinamo Tbilisi finding the net in the third minute, but G. Kharebava equalized for Kolkheti Poti by the 20th minute. In the second half, G. Melkadze scored for Kolkheti Poti in the 65th minute, but Dinamo Tbilisi's G. Moistsrapishvili tied the game again with a goal in stoppage time. Throughout the match, there were several substitutions made by both teams and a few yellow cards handed out, including to B. Kharshiladze of Kolkheti Poti and Cadete of Dinamo Tbilisi. The referee for the match was G. Kikacheishvili.

Trans Narva secured a 2-0 win over Tammeka in their Meistriliiga match at Tamme staadion on May 27, 2024. The visitors took the lead just before halftime with a goal from T. Usta in the 45+1 minute. In the second half, both teams made several substitutions, but it was Trans Narva who managed to score again, this time through S. Kukhianidze in the 89th minute. Throughout the match, several players received yellow cards, including D. Polyakov and M. Sepp, who were booked in the 30th and 45th minutes respectively. The game ultimately ended with Trans Narva claiming all three points, having outscored their opponents by two goals.

Zamalek SC secured a 2-0 win over Al Ittihad in their Premier League match at Borg El Arab Stadium. The away team took the lead in the 28th minute with a goal from Nasser Maher, assisted by Omar Gaber. In the second half, Zamalek SC doubled their advantage as S. Jaziri scored a normal goal, assisted by I. Ndiaye, in the 57th minute. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, with Al Ittihad making five changes and Zamalek SC making five as well. The match ultimately ended with Zamalek SC claiming the victory, while Al Ittihad's Omar El Wahsh and Abdelghani Mohamed, as well as Mabululu, received yellow cards during the game.

Brann II secured a 7-3 win over Vard at Varden Amfi on May 27, 2024. The home team took an early lead with goals from D. Tufekcic in the 20th and 21st minutes, adding another by the same player in the 32nd minute. By halftime, Brann II led 3-2, but they continued to score in the second half, with additional goals from M. Haaland, M. Haga, D. Tufekcic again, and J. Eikrem. Vard also scored in the second half through A. Harvey, but were unable to keep pace with Brann II's offense. The match saw several substitutions for both teams, as well as yellow cards given to W. Kvale of Brann II and T. Bjornebye of Vard.

Kongsvinger secured a 2-0 win over Sandnes ULF at Øster Hus Arena on May 27, 2024. The visitors took an early lead with L. Haren scoring in the 7th minute, followed by J. Grundt's goal in the 43rd minute. Both teams received yellow cards throughout the match, with Sandnes ULF's V. Solheim and H. Brkic, as well as Kongsvinger's L. Haren, J. Nilsson, being booked. Several substitutions were made during the game, including four changes by Sandnes ULF between the 46th and 76th minutes. The match ultimately ended with Kongsvinger claiming the victory, with referee S. Hauge overseeing the proceedings.

Stabaek hosted Egersund at Nadderud Stadion, with Stabaek taking an early lead through goals from T. Roberts, O. Spiten-Nysæter, and S. Olderheim, making it 3-0 by halftime. In the second half, R. Vinge added a fourth goal for Stabaek, but Egersund mounted a comeback with goals from J. Salmon, A. Helmersen (twice), M. Dahlby, and H. Elvevold in the final minutes of the game. The away team ultimately won 5-4. Several substitutions were made throughout the match by both teams, including four for Egersund and four for Stabaek. The referee for the match was E. Bodding.

Bryne hosted Ranheim at Bryne Stadion and won 3-2. The first half ended with a score of 1-1, with goals from G. Mogensen for Ranheim and L. Sødal for Bryne. In the second half, Duarte Moreira scored two goals for Bryne, one in the 66th minute and another in stoppage time, while S. Haugen scored for Ranheim in the 90th minute. There were several substitutions made by both teams throughout the game, including three by Ranheim between the 71st and 76th minutes. The match ultimately ended with Bryne claiming victory, with the final whistle blown after 90 minutes of play.

Norway's 1. Division match between Mjondalen and Moss took place at Consto Arena on May 27, 2024. The away team, Moss, scored first with a goal from T. Jakobsen in the 27th minute, leading 1-0 at halftime. In the second half, Mjondalen's M. Pedersen equalized with a goal in the 47th minute, but Moss regained the lead with another goal from S. Pedersen in the 54th minute, ultimately winning the game 2-1. Several substitutions were made throughout the match by both teams, including five by Mjondalen and three by Moss. The game saw multiple yellow cards issued to players on both sides, but no red cards or penalties were given during the 90-minute match.

Raufoss secured a 1-0 win over Lyn at NAMMO stadion on May 27, 2024. The first half ended goalless with both teams failing to find the back of the net. In the second half, Raufoss's J. Lynum scored the only goal of the game in the 71st minute. Prior to the goal, both teams had players booked for yellow cards, including M. Alm and T. Engebakken from Raufoss, while Lyn made several substitutions throughout the match. The game ultimately ended with Raufoss claiming the victory, as referee A. Medic blew the final whistle after 90 minutes of play.

Aalesund secured a 4-1 win over Asane at Color Line Stadion on May 27, 2024. The home team took an early lead with goals from I. Atanga and J. Kitolano in the 28th and 35th minutes respectively, making it 2-0 by halftime. In the second half, Cláudio Braga and M. Diop added to Aalesund's tally with goals in the 79th and 82nd minutes. Asane managed to score a consolation goal through T. Lotsberg in stoppage time. The match saw several substitutions from both teams, as well as yellow cards given to K. Barmen, S. Strand, and O. Kallevag of Asane.

Dila secured a 2-0 win over Dinamo Batumi at the Batumi Arena on May 27, 2024. The first half ended goalless with both teams failing to find the back of the net. In the second half, Dila's T. Wouter scored two goals in the 71st and 78th minutes to seal the victory for his team. Throughout the match, several substitutions were made by both teams, including four by Dinamo Batumi and five by Dila. The game also saw yellow cards given to L. Kutalia of Dinamo Batumi in the 25th minute and B. Mladjovic in the 87th minute.

trelleborgs FF secured a 3-2 win over GIF Sundsvall at Vångavallen on May 27, 2024. The home team took an early lead with E. Alievski scoring in the 30th minute, and maintained their advantage into halftime with a 1-0 scoreline. In the second half, both teams created scoring opportunities, with trelleborgs FF's F. Bohman and GIF Sundsvall's Y. Finey each finding the back of the net. The match saw several substitutions, including five made by GIF Sundsvall between the 51st and 75th minutes, as well as a total of eight yellow cards issued to players from both teams. Ultimately, trelleborgs FF emerged victorious, with N. Mortensen scoring in stoppage time to seal the win after Y. Finey had scored a penalty for GIF Sundsvall just moments earlier.

Utsikten secured a 1-0 win over IK Brage at the Bravida Arena on May 27, 2024. The first half ended goalless with both teams failing to find the back of the net. In the second half, F. Trpcevski scored the only goal of the game for Utsikten in the 85th minute from a penalty. Throughout the match, several yellow cards were handed out to players from both teams, including Albin Skoglund, Gustav Berggren, Alexander Zetterstrom, and Johan Arvidsson. The game saw multiple substitutions made by both teams, with Utsikten making five changes and IK Brage making three.

IFK Varnamo secured a 4-0 win over IFK Norrkoping at PlatinumCars Arena on May 27, 2024. The away team took an early lead with J. Kalu scoring in the 15th minute and maintained their advantage throughout the game. In the second half, IFK Varnamo extended their lead with goals from J. Kalu again in the 69th minute, G. Engvall in the 73rd minute, and C. Johansson in the 90+2 minute. Both teams made several substitutions during the match, with IFK Norrkoping making five changes and IFK Varnamo making three. The game saw a total of four yellow cards issued to players from both teams, but no red cards were given.

FC Gomel secured a 1-0 win over FC Dnepr Mogilev at Stadyen Spartak on May 27, 2024. The match remained goalless until the 90+2 minute when R. Effaghe scored for FC Gomel, securing the victory for his team. Prior to the goal, both teams made several substitutions, with a total of nine changes made throughout the game. Two yellow cards were issued during the match, one to Nikita Krasnov in the 33rd minute and another to Yuri Klochkov in the 90+6 minute. The win was sealed after a total of 90 minutes of play, with referee S. Stetsurin overseeing the proceedings.

Olympic hosted Lund at Lindängens IP in a match that ended with a 2-1 win for the visiting team. The home side took an early lead when A. Sundgren scored in the 20th minute, but Lund equalized before halftime through A. Kamp's goal in the 35th minute. The second half saw several substitutions from both teams, including four changes made by Olympic, and a red card was given to J. Andersson of Lund in the 28th minute. Despite being down a player, Lund managed to score again in the 77th minute courtesy of E. Zetterberg, securing their victory. The match ultimately ended with Lund claiming all three points, following the fulltime whistle blown by referee P. Lindh.

Angelholms FF secured a 2-1 win over Jonkopings Sodra at Stadsparksvallen on May 27, 2024. The away team took an early lead with A. Gustafson scoring in the 13th minute, and maintained their advantage going into halftime with a 1-0 scoreline. In the second half, L. Lyck equalized for Jonkopings Sodra in the 51st minute, but Angelholms FF regained the lead nine minutes later through M. Eriksson's goal. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards handed out to players from both teams, with a total of four bookings given to Angelholms FF's T. Amilon Persson, R. Streifert, and Jonkopings Sodra's J. Lindgren and H. Israelsson. Ultimately, Angelholms FF held on for the victory, with the final whistle blowing after 90 minutes of play.

Vålerenga II hosted Skeid at Intility Arena, with the away team ultimately winning 3-1. The first half ended 1-1, with goals from K. Kalabatama for Skeid and A. Rønning for Vålerenga II. In the second half, Skeid scored two more goals through K. Kalabatama again and U. Ness to seal their victory. There were several substitutions made by both teams throughout the game, with a total of nine changes. The match, refereed by H. Catalgøl, finished after 90 minutes with Skeid claiming the win.

CSKA 1948 secured a win against Slavia Sofia with a final score of 2-0. The first goal was scored by Pedrinho in the fifth minute, giving CSKA 1948 an early lead. In the second half, N. Iliev added another goal for CSKA 1948 in the 63rd minute, solidifying their advantage. Throughout the match, both teams made several substitutions, with Slavia Sofia making five changes and CSKA 1948 making three. The game ultimately ended with CSKA 1948 emerging as the winner, with the final whistle blown by referee G. Ginchev after 90 minutes of play.

Arda Kardzhali secured a 1-0 win over Botev Plovdiv at Stadion Hristo Botev on May 27, 2024. The only goal of the match was scored by T. Yordanov in the 37th minute for Arda Kardzhali. Both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the game, with Arda Kardzhali making four changes and Botev Plovdiv making five. Several yellow cards were handed out to Arda Kardzhali players, including Stanislav Ivanov, Okezie Prince Ebenezer, and Plamen Krachunov, all for different infractions. The match ultimately ended with Arda Kardzhali claiming the victory, as referee V. El Hatib blew the final whistle after 90 minutes of play.

Csikszereda and Dinamo Bucuresti played to a scoreless draw at Stadionul Municipal on May 27, 2024. The match saw several yellow cards issued, with Dávid Kelemen of Csikszereda receiving one in the 6th minute, followed by Domagoj Pavičić of Dinamo Bucuresti in the 29th minute, and Ahmed Bani of Dinamo Bucuresti in the 66th minute. Benjamin Babati of Csikszereda also received a yellow card in the 81st minute. Both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the game, with Csikszereda making four changes and Dinamo Bucuresti making five. The match ultimately ended 0-0 after 90 minutes, with referee H. Feșnic overseeing the proceedings.

Maghreb Fès and Hassania Agadir played to a 2-2 draw at Stade Hassan-II in Fès. The scoring began early, with M. Bouriga of Maghreb Fès finding the net in the 8th minute, followed by a goal from H. Afsal of Hassania Agadir in the 25th minute, leaving the teams tied 1-1 at halftime. In the second half, S. El Moudane scored on a penalty for Hassania Agadir in the 62nd minute, but Maghreb Fès equalized with another penalty goal from M. Bouriga in the 77th minute. The match saw several yellow cards issued to players from both teams, including four to Maghreb Fès players and one to a Hassania Agadir player. Ultimately, the teams finished level after 90 minutes of play, with the final score remaining 2-2.

AIK Stockholm secured a 5-2 win over IFK Goteborg at Strawberry Arena on May 27, 2024. The match was closely contested in the first half, with both teams scoring one goal each by halftime. In the second half, AIK Stockholm scored four more goals, including one own goal by IFK Goteborg's player, while IFK Goteborg managed to score only one additional goal. Several substitutions were made throughout the game, with a total of seven changes for IFK Goteborg and three for AIK Stockholm. The match ultimately ended with AIK Stockholm emerging as the winner, with the final whistle blown after 90 minutes plus stoppage time.

Portugal U17 and France U17 faced off in a Group Stage match of the UEFA U17 Championship on May 27, 2024, at Stadio Vitex Ammochostos Epistrofi in Larnaca. The two teams were evenly matched in the first half, with both scoring one goal each by the 38th minute, courtesy of E. Sternal for France and Afonso Patrão for Portugal. In the second half, France U17 managed to score another goal through E. Molébé in the 81st minute, ultimately securing a 2-1 victory over their opponents. Throughout the match, several substitutions were made by both teams, with a total of nine changes taking place between the two sides. The game also saw three yellow cards handed out, two to France U17 players and one to a Portugal U17 player, before coming to a close after 90 minutes.

England U17 secured a 3-1 win over Spain U17 in their Group Stage match at Stadio Antonis Papadopoulos. The two teams were level at halftime with one goal each, courtesy of S. Mheuka for England and Adrián Arnu for Spain. In the second half, England scored two more goals through M. Moore and E. Nwaneri to seal the victory. Meanwhile, Spain's J. Fortea received a red card in the 89th minute after being booked earlier in the game. The match ultimately ended with England emerging as winners, with referee J. Vergoote overseeing the proceedings.

Al Taawon secured a 1-0 win over Al-Ettifaq at the Al Taawon Club Stadium on May 27, 2024. The first half ended goalless with both teams creating few scoring opportunities. In the second half, Abdulmalik Al Oyayari scored the only goal of the game for Al Taawon in the 90th minute, assisted by Mohammed Al Kuwaykibi. Several yellow cards were handed out during the match, including to Ashraf El Mahdioui and Aloyayari Abdulmalik from Al Taawon, as well as Ali Hazazi and Radhi Al-Oteibi from Al-Ettifaq. The game saw multiple substitutions in the final minutes, with Al Taawon making five changes and Al-Ettifaq making two.

Al-Hazm secured a 2-1 win over Abha at Ar-Rass Stadium on May 27, 2024. The first half ended goalless, with both teams creating few scoring opportunities. Abha's Ahmed Abdu broke the deadlock in the 47th minute, but Al-Hazm responded with goals from M. Badamosi and Mohammed Al Thani in the 58th and 80th minutes, respectively. Throughout the match, several substitutions were made by both teams, including five by Abha. The game also saw a number of yellow cards handed out to players from both sides, as well as a red card given to Marcel Tisserand of Abha in stoppage time.

Al-Nassr defeated Al-Ittihad FC 4-2 in a match played at Al Awal Park at King Saud University. The home team took an early lead with Cristiano Ronaldo scoring in the 45th minute, assisted by Mohammed Al Fatil. In the second half, Al-Nassr extended their lead with goals from Cristiano Ronaldo and Abdulrahman Ghareeb, while Al-Ittihad FC scored through Farhah Al Shamrani and Fabinho. The match saw several substitutions, with both teams making multiple changes throughout the game. Swailem Al-Menhali of Al-Ittihad FC was given a red card in the 66th minute for a professional foul, while several players from both teams received yellow cards.

Al Shabab secured a 3-2 win over Al-Fateh at the Al-Shabab Club Stadium on May 27, 2024. The home team took an early lead with a goal from Hussain Al Sibyani in the 14th minute and maintained their advantage until halftime, leading 1-0. In the second half, Al-Fateh's M. Saâdane scored in the 51st minute to level the score, but Al Shabab responded with goals from Vitinho in the 72nd minute and Musab Al Juwayr in the 89th minute. Al-Fateh managed to pull one back through J. Denayer in stoppage time, but it was not enough to change the outcome of the match. The game saw several substitutions and bookings, including a red card for Al Shabab's Hussain Alsebyani in the 59th minute.

Al Akhdoud secured a 2-0 win over Al Taee in their Pro League match at Prince Abdul Aziz bin Musa'ed Stadium. The away team took the lead just before halftime with a goal from S. Godwin, assisted by Naif Asiri, in the 42nd minute. In the second half, L. Tawamba doubled Al Akhdoud's advantage with a normal goal in the 50th minute. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, with Al Taee making four changes and Al Akhdoud making three. The match ultimately ended with Al Akhdoud claiming the victory, as the final whistle blew after 90 minutes of play.

Al Riyadh secured a 2-1 win over Al Khaleej Saihat in their Pro League match at Prince Mohamed bin Fahd Stadium. The first half ended goalless, but the visitors took control in the second half with goals from B. Touré and A. Gray. Al Khaleej Saihat managed to pull one back through a penalty scored by Abdullah Al Salem in the 87th minute. Throughout the match, several players received yellow cards, including Ahmad Asiri, Mohammed Al Shwirekh, Naif Masoud, Andre Gray, and Ivo Rodrigues. The game ultimately ended with Al Riyadh claiming the victory, as confirmed by referee Sami Al Jires after the full 90 minutes.

The match between Damac and Al-Raed ended with a 1-1 draw at Dhamak Club Stadium. The home team took an early lead when F. Chafaï scored a goal assisted by G. Nkoudou in the 7th minute. However, Al-Raed equalized late in the game with an own goal from Abdulbasit Hawsawi in the 89th minute. Throughout the match, several substitutions were made by both teams, including four by Al-Raed and four by Damac. Additionally, a total of five yellow cards were given to players from both teams for various infractions during the game.
